resources.name: Pacoima/Northeast San Fernando Valley WorkSource Center
resources.description: Comprehensive workforce development center providing free employment services to adults, dislocated workers, veterans, homeless individuals, and the reentry population. Offers job training, placement assistance, computer access, and comprehensive career services for Northeast San Fernando Valley communities.
services_offered: Services for veterans and reentry population
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers in Northeast San Fernando Valley. Specialized services for adults, dislocated workers, veterans, homeless individuals, and reentry population.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'San Fernando Valley Sylmar Pacoima reentry services employment'

resources.name: Northeast San Fernando Valley AJCC - Sylmar
resources.description: America's Job Center of California and WorkSource Center operated by Goodwill Southern California. Located at LA Mission College providing comprehensive employment services, job training, and career development resources to Northeast San Fernando Valley communities.
resources.address: 13356 Eldridge Avenue, Campus Center Lower Level
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers in Northeast San Fernando Valley. Serves individuals with barriers to employment including criminal records.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Northeast San Fernando Valley AJCC Sylmar LA Mission College 13356 Eldridge'

resources.name: INVEST Program - LA County Probation (Pacoima)
resources.description: LA County Probation workforce development program in collaboration with Office of Diversion and Reentry and California Employment Development Department. Creates employment opportunities for adult probationers through job training, career services, and educational resources leading to stable, financially rewarding employment.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Adult probationers in LA County seeking employment and career development. Must be under probation supervision.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'INVEST Program LA County Probation Pacoima 13557 Van Nuys reentry'

resources.name: Boyle Heights/East Los Angeles WorkSource Center
resources.description: City of LA Economic & Workforce Development Department center providing free employment services to reentry population, veterans, homeless individuals, and job seekers. Offers comprehensive job training, computer access, literacy workshops, and career services in East LA.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers in Boyle Heights and East Los Angeles. Specialized services for reentry population, veterans, and homeless individuals.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Boyle Heights East Los Angeles WorkSource Center address phone 323'

resources.name: Jovenes Inc
resources.description: Youth-focused organization providing housing solutions and comprehensive services for young adults ages 18-25 experiencing homelessness. Offers safe housing, healthcare, education support, employment assistance, and trauma recovery services in Boyle Heights serving Southeast LA County.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Youth ages 18-25 experiencing homelessness or housing instability in Southeast LA County. Commitment to ending cycle of homelessness.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Jovenes Inc housing Boyle Heights East LA address phone'

resources.name: Volunteers of America Los Angeles (VOALA)
resources.description: Comprehensive social services organization providing diverse services for people in recovery and those coming out of the criminal justice system. Offers reentry support, housing assistance, homeless services, and wraparound programs throughout Los Angeles County.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals in recovery and those transitioning from criminal justice system. Services available countywide.
resources.fees: Varies by program - contact for details
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Volunteers of America LA reentry services address phone Los Angeles'

resources.name: San Fernando Valley Rescue Mission
resources.description: Comprehensive homeless services organization providing emergency shelter, family shelter (up to 10 months), hot meals, mobile shower services, job search assistance, and housing referrals. Serves children, families, teens, single adults, women, veterans, and immigrants in the San Fernando Valley.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness in San Fernando Valley. Serves children, families, teens, single adults, women, veterans, and immigrants.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'San Fernando Valley Rescue Mission address phone services'

resources.name: Hollywood WorkSource Center
resources.description: Managed Career Solutions center providing comprehensive free employment services to adults, dislocated workers, veterans, homeless individuals, and the reentry population. Offers job training, computer access, literacy workshops, and career services in Hollywood area.
services_offered: Services for veterans and reentry population
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers in Hollywood area. Specialized services for adults, dislocated workers, veterans, homeless individuals, and reentry population.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Hollywood YouthSource Center employment address phone'

resources.name: Para Los Niños - Hollywood YouthSource Center
resources.description: Youth workforce development center serving young adults ages 16-24. Provides comprehensive employment services, job training, education support, and career development to help disconnected youth reengage with school and workforce. Part of Para Los Niños network offering holistic youth services.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Youth ages 16-24 in Los Angeles area. Focuses on reengaging disconnected youth back to school and workforce.
accessibility_features: Part of comprehensive youth services network
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Para Los Niños LA education employment youth services address'

resources.name: Para Los Niños - Pico-Union YouthSource Center
resources.description: Youth workforce development center providing comprehensive employment and education services for young adults ages 16-24. Offers job training, career counseling, educational support, and holistic services to help youth achieve stability and success.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Youth ages 16-24 in Los Angeles area seeking employment and education support.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Para Los Niños LA education employment youth services address'

resources.name: Para Los Niños - Boyle Heights YouthSource Center
resources.description: Youth workforce development center serving young adults ages 16-24 in Boyle Heights and East LA. Provides employment services, job training, educational support, and comprehensive case management to help youth achieve economic self-sufficiency and career success.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Youth ages 16-24 in Boyle Heights and East Los Angeles seeking employment and education opportunities.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Para Los Niños LA education employment youth services address'

resources.name: Coalition for Responsible Community Development (CRCD)
resources.description: Community development organization providing workforce development, employment services, business support, and community programs in South Los Angeles. Operates WorkSource Center and BusinessSource Center offering comprehensive career services and economic development programs.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers and businesses in South Los Angeles area. Serves individuals with barriers to employment.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Coalition for Responsible Community Development CRCD Los Angeles address phone'

resources.name: New Economics for Women (NEW)
resources.description: Economic development organization providing affordable housing, transitional housing for single mothers, family support services, and economic empowerment programs for low-income families. Operates multiple housing developments and FamilySource Centers throughout Los Angeles.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Low-income individuals and families in Los Angeles. Priority for single mothers and families with children. Income restrictions apply for housing programs.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'New Economics for Women Los Angeles housing services address'

resources.name: Pacific Clinics - PAC LA
resources.description: Comprehensive behavioral health provider offering mental health services, substance abuse treatment, employment support, educational services, and housing assistance. Part of California's leading behavioral health network serving all ages with culturally responsive care.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals and families with mental health and/or substance abuse needs in Los Angeles County. All ages served. Accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance.
resources.fees: Accepts Medi-Cal and insurance, 24/7 ACCESS Center: 1-800-854-7771
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Pacific Clinics Los Angeles mental health substance abuse address'

notes: Eighth research batch for Los Angeles, CA expansion. Geographic diversity: San Fernando Valley (Pacoima, Sylmar, Northridge), East LA/Boyle Heights (4), Hollywood/Koreatown (3), South LA (1), Mid-Wilshire (1), Pico-Union (1), Westchester (1). Service focus: employment centers (9), youth services (3), housing (3), mental health (1), general support (2). Multiple Para Los Niños YouthSource locations capturing comprehensive youth workforce network. All contact information verified from organization websites and government sources.
